question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Input validation] Can an attacker provide a version number that is not a multiple of FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT (1000) to bypass batch boundary validation, potentially causing integer overflow or accessing transactions outside intended boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Integer overflow] Can providing u64::MAX or near-maximum version values cause integer overflow when calculating file offsets or transaction indices, leading to memory corruption or incorrect data retrieval? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to get_transactions() for the same version create race conditions in the underlying file store implementations, causing data corruption or inconsistent reads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Error handling] Does the method properly handle errors from get_transactions_with_durations(), or can suppressed errors lead to returning corrupted transaction data without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file()] [Path traversal] Can an attacker manipulate the version parameter to construct malicious file paths in implementations, potentially accessing files outside the intended storage directory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file()] [Resource exhaustion] Can requesting extremely large version numbers cause implementations to allocate excessive memory when building file paths or reading non-existent files, leading to DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file()] [Information disclosure] Does error handling in get_raw_file() leak sensitive file system paths or storage bucket structure information to unauthorized callers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file_with_retries()] [Integer underflow] Can the retry loop at line 49-50 cause integer underflow if retries is 0 initially, or can it be manipulated to retry infinitely consuming resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file_with_retries()] [Retry bomb] Can an attacker trigger persistent failures in get_raw_file() causing the retry loop to execute maximum times repeatedly, amplifying resource consumption and causing DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file_with_retries()] [Timing attack] Does the fixed 10ms sleep at line 53 allow timing-based attacks to probe file existence or storage state by observing retry patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file_with_retries()] [Metrics manipulation] Can the TRANSACTION_STORE_FETCH_RETRIES counter at lines 45-47 be manipulated to hide actual retry rates or overflow counter storage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_raw_file_with_retries()] [Race condition on retries] Can concurrent modification of the retries parameter in the loop create race conditions where retries never decrements properly, causing infinite loops? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Thread panic exploit] Can malicious transaction data cause the spawn_blocking thread at line 70-74 to panic with a crafted error that's not properly caught, potentially crashing the indexer service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Memory exhaustion] Can providing version values that cause FileEntry::new() to allocate excessive memory in the blocking thread lead to OOM conditions bypassing main thread protections? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Integer overflow in skip] Can the modulo operation version % FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT at line 81 combined with skip() at line 81 cause integer overflow when version is near u64::MAX, accessing wrong transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Transaction boundary bypass] Can manipulating version to be just below a FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT boundary cause the skip operation to wrap around and return transactions from a different batch? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Timing side channel] Do the io_duration and decoding_duration measurements at lines 64-76 leak sensitive information about storage performance that could be used to infer file store state or transaction content? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Deserialization attack] Can corrupted bytes from get_raw_file_with_retries() at line 65 cause FileEntry::new() or into_transactions_in_storage() to panic or execute malicious code through deserialization vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_transactions_with_durations()] [Resource leak] If the spawn_blocking task is cancelled or panics, are the bytes and storage_format properly cleaned up, or can repeated failures cause memory leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_file_store_metadata()] [Metadata tampering] Can an attacker with storage access modify the metadata.json file to manipulate chain_id, version, or storage_format values, causing indexer to serve incorrect transaction data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_file_store_metadata()] [Missing authentication] Does get_file_store_metadata() verify the integrity of metadata using signatures or checksums, or can modified metadata be served without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_file_store_metadata()] [Panic vulnerability] Can implementations panic on metadata access errors (as suggested by line 87 comment), causing service disruption when metadata is temporarily unavailable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_file_store_metadata()] [Race condition] Can concurrent reads of metadata while it's being updated return partially written or corrupted metadata, causing chain_id mismatches or version inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout()] [Chain ID validation bypass] Can an attacker bypass the expected_chain_id validation by creating race conditions between metadata checks and updates, allowing wrong chain data to be indexed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout()] [Timeout bypass] Can manipulating system time or creating race conditions bypass the FILE_STORE_METADATA_TIMEOUT_MILLIS timeout check, allowing rapid metadata updates that corrupt the file store?
